ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Pain Resilience Scale question regarding extent to which the statement describes how participant responds when faced with intense or prolonged pain: I will get back out there.
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=To a slight degree; 2=To a moderate degree; 3=To a great degree; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: Pain Resilience Scale question regarding extent to which the statement describes how participant responds when faced with intense or prolonged pain: I still work to accomplish my goals
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=To a slight degree; 2=To a moderate degree; 3=To a great degree; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: Pain Resilience Scale question regarding extent to which the statement describes how participant responds when faced with intense or prolonged pain: I push through it.
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=To a slight degree; 2=To a moderate degree; 3=To a great degree; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: Pain Resilience Scale question regarding extent to which the statement describes how participant responds when faced with intense or prolonged pain: I try to continue working.
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=To a slight degree; 2=To a moderate degree; 3=To a great degree; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: Pain Resilience Scale question regarding extent to which the statement describes how participant responds when faced with intense or prolonged pain: I like to stay active.
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=To a slight degree; 2=To a moderate degree; 3=To a great degree; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: Pain Resilience Scale question regarding extent to which the statement describes how participant responds when faced with intense or prolonged pain: I focus on positive attitude.
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=To a slight degree; 2=To a moderate degree; 3=To a great degree; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: Pain Resilience Scale question regarding extent to which the statement describes how participant responds when faced with intense or prolonged pain: I keep a positive attitude
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=To a slight degree; 2=To a moderate degree; 3=To a great degree; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: Pain Resilience Scale question regarding extent to which the statement describes how participant responds when faced with intense or prolonged pain: It doesn't affect my happiness.
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=To a slight degree; 2=To a moderate degree; 3=To a great degree; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: Pain Resilience Scale question regarding extent to which the statement describes how participant responds when faced with intense or prolonged pain: I still find joy in my life.
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=To a slight degree; 2=To a moderate degree; 3=To a great degree; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: Pain Resilience Scale question regarding extent to which the statement describes how participant responds when faced with intense or prolonged pain: I keep a hopeful attitude.
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=To a slight degree; 2=To a moderate degree; 3=To a great degree; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: Pain Resilience Scale question regarding extent to which the statement describes how participant responds when faced with intense or prolonged pain: I don't let it get me down.
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=To a slight degree; 2=To a moderate degree; 3=To a great degree; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: Pain Resilience Scale question regarding extent to which the statement describes how participant responds when faced with intense or prolonged pain: I don't let it upset me.
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=To a slight degree; 2=To a moderate degree; 3=To a great degree; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: Pain Resilience Scale question regarding extent to which the statement describes how participant responds when faced with intense or prolonged pain: I avoid negative thoughts.
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=To a slight degree; 2=To a moderate degree; 3=To a great degree; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: Pain Resilience Scale question regarding extent to which the statement describes how participant responds when faced with intense or prolonged pain: I try to stay relaxed.
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=To a slight degree; 2=To a moderate degree; 3=To a great degree; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: Calculated total (summed) score for the Pain Resilience Score
Calculated subscale score for Behavioral Perseverance, as part of the Pain Resilience Score
Notes: Sum of prsbackoutscl, prsworkgoalsscl, prspushthroughscl, prscontworkscl, prsstayactivescl

ElementDescription: Calculated subscale score for Cognitive/Affective, as part of the Pain Resilience Score
Notes: Sum of prsfocuspositivescl, prsposattitudescl, prsnotaffecthappyscl, prsfindjoyscl, prshopefulscl, prsnotgetdownscl, prsnotupsetscl, prsavoidnegativescl, prsstayrelaxscl
